title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement fanxingfu3344@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: A Package for Rna-seq Analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(rnaseq) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
text: function creates bar plot gene enrichment analysis results, displaying counts gene ratios enriched terms across different ontology categories. plot faceted ontology categories, number items displayed per facet can limited using topn parameter.

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
code: enrichment_barplot(   data,   output_file = NULL,   width = 6,   height = 8,   dpi = 300,   topn = 10,   use_gene_ratio = FALSE )

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
text: data data frame containing enrichment analysis results. must include following columns: Description Character vector, descriptions enriched terms. GeneRatio Numeric vector, gene ratios (optional use_gene_ratio FALSE). Count Numeric vector, counts genes term (optional use_gene_ratio TRUE). p.adjust Numeric vector, adjusted p-values multiple testing. ONTOLOGY Character vector, ontology categories, "Biological Process", "Molecular Function", "Cellular Component". output_file string specifying file path save plot. provided, plot saved file. Default NULL. width Numeric, width saved plot inches. Default 6. height Numeric, height saved plot inches. Default 8. dpi Numeric, resolution saved plot dots per inch. Default 300. topn Integer, maximum number items display per ontology category. ontology category topn items, items lowest p.adjust values displayed. Default 10. use_gene_ratio Logical, whether use GeneRatio x-axis. FALSE, Count used. Default FALSE.

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
text: output_file provided, function saves plot specified path returns NULL. Otherwise, returns ggplot object.

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
text: function uses ggplot2 create faceted bar plot enrichment results. default, plots Count genes enriched term x-axis. Setting use_gene_ratio = TRUE plot GeneRatio instead. bars ordered within facet based p.adjust values. topn parameter allows limit number terms displayed per ontology category significant ones based adjusted p-values. output_file provided, plot saved specified file, function returns NULL. Otherwise, ggplot object returned customization immediate display.

title: Enrichment Analysis Bar Plot — enrichment_barplot
code: # Create example data frame with necessary columns df <- data.frame(   Description = paste0("Term", 1:15),   GeneRatio = runif(15, 0.1, 0.3),   Count = sample(10:50, 15, replace = TRUE),   p.adjust = 10^(-runif(15, 1, 5)),   ONTOLOGY = rep(c("Biological Process", "Molecular Function", "Cellular Component"), each = 5) ) # Generate bar plot without saving to file p <- enrichment_barplot(df, topn = 3)

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
text: function creates dot plot gene enrichment analysis results, displaying gene ratios counts enriched terms across different ontology categories. plot faceted ontology categories, number items displayed per facet can limited using topn parameter.

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
code: enrichment_dotplot(   data,   output_file = NULL,   width = 6,   height = 8,   dpi = 300,   topn = 10,   low_color = "blue",   high_color = "red",   use_gene_ratio = TRUE )

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
text: data data frame containing enrichment analysis results. must include following columns: Description Character vector, descriptions enriched terms. GeneRatio Numeric vector, gene ratios (optional use_gene_ratio FALSE). Count Numeric vector, counts genes term (optional use_gene_ratio TRUE). p.adjust Numeric vector, adjusted p-values multiple testing. ONTOLOGY Character vector, ontology categories, "Biological Process", "Molecular Function", "Cellular Component". output_file string specifying file path save plot. provided, plot saved file. Default NULL. width Numeric, width saved plot inches. Default 6. height Numeric, height saved plot inches. Default 8. dpi Numeric, resolution saved plot dots per inch. Default 300. topn Integer, maximum number items display per ontology category. ontology category topn items, items lowest p.adjust values displayed. Default 10. low_color string specifying color representing low values color gradient. Default "blue". high_color string specifying color representing high values color gradient. Default "red". use_gene_ratio Logical, whether use GeneRatio x-axis. FALSE, Count used. Default TRUE.

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
text: output_file provided, function saves plot specified path returns NULL. Otherwise, returns ggplot object.

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
text: function uses ggplot2 create faceted dot plot enrichment results. default, plots GeneRatio x-axis. Setting use_gene_ratio = FALSE plot Count instead. points ordered within facet based p.adjust values. topn parameter allows limit number terms displayed per ontology category significant ones based adjusted p-values. output_file provided, plot saved specified file, function returns NULL. Otherwise, ggplot object returned customization immediate display.

title: Enrichment Analysis Dot Plot — enrichment_dotplot
code: # Create example data frame with necessary columns df <- data.frame(   Description = paste0("Term", 1:15),   GeneRatio = runif(15, 0.1, 0.3),   Count = sample(10:50, 15, replace = TRUE),   p.adjust = 10^(-runif(15, 1, 5)),   ONTOLOGY = rep(c("Biological Process", "Molecular Function", "Cellular Component"), each = 5) ) # Generate dot plot without saving to file p <- enrichment_dotplot(df, topn = 3) print(p)

title: Fancy Print Messages — fancy_print
text: Prints messages fancy decorations.

title: Fancy Print Messages — fancy_print
text: messages character vector messages print.

title: Fancy Print Messages — fancy_print
text: None. Messages printed console.

text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

text: result calling rhs(lhs).
